fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.resolution

Class FileResolutionBuilder<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<P>
      • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.resolution.AbstractSingleResolutionBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>,P>
        • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.resolution.FileResolutionBuilder<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling AbstractParent.and() method)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<ResourceResolver>, Parent<P>, PrefixSuffixBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>>

    public class FileResolutionBuilder<P>
extends AbstractSingleResolutionBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>,P>
implements PrefixSuffixBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>>
    Configure resource resolver that loads files from filesystem.

    You can define the lookup (the prefix that indicates that filesystem resolution must be used). For example: 

     .file().lookup("file:");
 
 // path prefixed by file: matches 
 // then file resolver is used
 resourceResolver.getResource("file:foo/bar.html");
 // path is not prefixed (or using another prefix) doesn't match 
 // then file resolver is not used
 resourceResolver.getResource("foo/bar.html");

    You can define a path prefix and suffix for finding resources: 

     .file().lookup("file:").pathPrefix("foo/").pathSuffix(".html");
 
 resourceResolver.getResource("bar");
    This will use the file resolver and the real path is foo/bar.html.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileResolutionBuilder

        public FileResolutionBuilder(P parent,
                             EnvironmentBuilder<?> environmentBuilder)
        Initializes with the parent builder and the EnvironmentBuilder. The parent builder is used when calling the AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used when calling AbstractSingleResolutionBuilder.build() method in order to evaluate property values (defined by pathPrefix(String...) or pathSuffix(String...)).
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        environmentBuilder - configuration about property resolution

    • Method Detail

      • createResolver

        protected ResourceResolver createResolver()
        Specified by:
        createResolver in class AbstractSingleResolutionBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>,P>

      • pathPrefix

        public FileResolutionBuilder<P> pathPrefix(String... pathPrefix)
        Description copied from interface: PrefixSuffixBuilder
        You can set the path prefix for resource resolution. The aim is to define only the name of the resource (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the resource resolution easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix path to /foo/template/. You can now reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount.html
        • resetPassword.html

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .pathPrefix("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method of the specialized resource resolution builder is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Specified by:
        pathPrefix in interface PrefixSuffixBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>>
        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - one path prefix, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • pathSuffix

        public FileResolutionBuilder<P> pathSuffix(String... pathSuffix)
        Description copied from interface: PrefixSuffixBuilder
        You can set the path suffix for resource resolution. The aim is to define only the name of the resource (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the resource resolution easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into resetPassword.html
        So you can set the suffix path to .html. You can now reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount
        • resetPassword

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .pathSuffix("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method of the specialized resource resolution builder is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Specified by:
        pathSuffix in interface PrefixSuffixBuilder<FileResolutionBuilder<P>>
        Parameters:
        pathSuffix - one path suffix, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
